website_summaries.verdict: Designed for construction professionals, this heater offers reliable spot heat.
pros: Can run continuously for up to 11 hours
Powerful enough to heat up to 1,750 square feet, making it safe for indoor or outdoor use
Easy to use and can be used directly out of the box
cons: At nearly 40 pounds, this is not the easiest heater to move around

customer_reviews.title: Where is the performance and integrity of products made in America????
customer_reviews.text: Repairs had to be made, unit was not even a year old. Pass this product by....I had to find my own certified service tech close by, the manufacture had me traveling to another state, the manufacture said over the phone these problems usually are solve over the phone call, you have water in your kerosene that is the reason for no ignition..they lied. over a hundred dollars repairs, parts, labor....very sad there was a time I remember when the name Dewalt ranked among the best products made in America...today it's a crap shoot if you get a product that has been quality control checked and will last at least 1 to 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: A really, really nice heater!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to heat my 2 1/2 garage here in NE Ohio. It replaces a 55,000 BTU Rediheater that was 20 years old and finally retired. The motor died and the replacement was $136! This bad boy was less than twice the price. And for that I got 75000 BTUs, thermostatic control, and Dewalt quality! I couldn't be happier and use it daily. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C.

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: First off this thing makes heat. It does its main job. It’s noisier than my pro temp was. It seems more durable and well built than the pro temp. I’m running store bought kerosene and no complaints there. One downside compared to pro temp was my old one had the pressure gauge built in from factory, this one you have to add in. Other thing I haven’t tested is the built in thermostat, not sure how accurate it is, there is no temperature rating on the thermostat it’s just more or less heat. Overall happy
customer_reviews.author: J. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Nice heat.
customer_reviews.text: We used it all winter on the back patio in Arizona. Plenty of heat very quickly. It started nightly with no issues. It is a little loud. We ran diesel 2 in it but it an run on multiple fuels. As any kerosene/diesel heater the smell takes getting used to. It runs about 9 hours on a full tank on maximum.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A.

customer_reviews.title: One year later... happy with purchase, works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: After 22 years, my 65k BTU Reddy Heater finally gave out. I made a bad choice on my first replacement heater (too big and too noisy), so I did some more research and settled on this DeWalt heater. Going on 1 year later and I've had no problems. Yes, the noise level is a bit higher given the 10k BTU increase for this heater over my old heater, but it isn't bad. I highly recommend this DeWalt heater.
customer_reviews.author: rkroeber

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of work in my unheated garage, so this heater makes life much easier. Takes only minutes to get the temperature to what you want. Simple to use and comes with an integrated thermostat to keep the area comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TR Foster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heater
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews before buying, heater came well package and prompt delivery. Thermostat works well I don't understand why some people had problems with thermostat, I guess they don't understand the concept of warm air rises and thermostat is built into heater on the floor. (set it accordingly) 75,000 BTU heater kept my 28x30 block garage at a nice and warm temperature during northeast winter. I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Researched them all and picked the right one.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing unit that produces a lot of heat. I like how clean it burns and ease of operation. No hiccups or spills. I spent hours researching heaters for my one car garage and I am very pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin J.

customer_reviews.title: Instant Heat
customer_reviews.text: Works great, put the handle on, filled it up with diesel , plugged it in, turned it on. Instant heat we use for a outdoor building we use off and on during the winter months
customer_reviews.author: Garry W.

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Easy as adding fuel to it. Initial impressions are all good. Hope it lasts as long as my smaller dewalt heater.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Bajo

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome to heat two car garages . Kept me really warm
customer_reviews.author: richard burrell

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Used to heat up my shop building. Only regret is that I should have gotten the next size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Bradham

customer_reviews.title: heater works great. I just wish there was a thermostat over ...
customer_reviews.text: heater works great. I just wish there was a thermostat over ride option. When trying to heat up an area for drying purposes, it turns off too soon
customer_reviews.author: Grady M

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift to my son. He loves it. Heats just as well as the bigger units.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Heat me up
customer_reviews.text: My husband says it’s the bomb!! Thermostat regulated and worth it’s cost !!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cheap solution to heat garage safely
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little noisy but works great. Little bit on the fumes but getting better thru use and venting. Gets my garage with a comfortable temperature to do things. Got a cheap little wheel cart to move it around. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J Perschbacher

customer_reviews.title: JOSAFA S
customer_reviews.text: trash, lost money. It doesn't stay on for more than 20 seconds and only smoke comes out. It's no use. I bought Dwalt because I thought it would be the best brand but I was wrong. DO NOT buy this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Josafá do espirito Santo Silva

customer_reviews.title: great heater
customer_reviews.text: great for working in the garage in New England weather.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W

customer_reviews.title: works right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: its small size but lots of heat it took 5 minutes to heat a 12 by 220 uninsulated shed so warm i culd have worked in my underware BUT I DIDNT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bell

customer_reviews.title: its dewalt, nice price too.
customer_reviews.text: i need heat outdoors to make things a little easier for me this winter.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Deaton

customer_reviews.title: ... is the first dewalt and so far I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: have owned a couple heaters this is the first dewalt and so far I really like it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great heater, we'll worth the $!
customer_reviews.text: I've used, put into service and repaired a few dozen of these heaters over the years and this is by far the most robust and reliable one I've ever used. The only thing I would change is to add a guage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture not correct to what I got.
customer_reviews.text: Older version all black 2 piece top, one shown is a one piece silver top. Problely just as good but you can’t go by the picture posted on what you see your buying. Not a good practice in selling Have not run it yet but it should be good.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hower

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good working heater, I wish I could get it for this price again, I'd buy another. I like the smaller heaters because of fuel efficiency, and this one doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Rodcopter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect garage heater.
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box. Used diesel fuel and had no problems. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_paulc

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my son for Christmas. He ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son for Christmas. He just had a barn built and will be able to work outside this winter and stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: Marty C.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, this little monster heats up faster and produces more hot hair than my ReddyHeat 125k BTU unit. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Does well. I like that it runs on multiple fuels. The heat is more directional than the Sunstream it replaced. That is the Sunstream had a much larger radiant screen. Kind of like comparing a rifle to a shotgun.
customer_reviews.author: afinepoint

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these last winter for work and right now I’m down to only one of them working. Two of them the electric motor just won’t turn. They are bound up. The third one will fire for only a few seconds and then blow a cloud of smoke. I have another one that is a different brand and 15 years old it it still work. These “dewalt” heaters are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ron fetzer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is frankly much more than I'll need for my garage and shed work places, but I love it! It's very easy to install (just a couple pieces to attach) and runs really well on kerosene. (I'll not be getting diesel or jet fuel. Jet fuel!?) Heated up my garage very quickly. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt DXH75KT Kerosene Heater, 75K BTU is the perfect little turbo heater.
customer_reviews.text: The DeWalt DXH75KT Kerosene Heater, 75K BTU is a great help to quickly heat my garage. I have been in the market for a turbo heater for quite some time now and this has not disappointed. Out of the box just 4 screws to attach the top handle, pour in the kerosene, plug in and hit the power button. It was that simple. I will be using this often in the fall and winter. May actually come up with projects to do around the house now.
customer_reviews.author: Hunting Creek

product_meta.title: DeWalt F340675 DXH75KT Kerosene Heater, 75K BTU,Yellow
product_meta.description: The DeWalt 75K BTU forced air kerosene heater. Rugged two-piece split barrel, designed to make cleaning and maintenance easier and safer. Ergonomic handle for easy transport. Recessed controls and thermostat control designed to reduce the risk of having the knobs or valves damaged on the jobsite. Continuous electronic ignition is always present as a source of ignition for unburned fuel, reducing the ability for fuels to pool and collect.
feature_bullets: Typical uses Work shops, Barns, Job sites, Home Remodeling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars87 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
